examples: he made a note of the appointment
drop me a line when you get there

definitions.text: a notation representing the pitch and duration of a musical sound
examples: the singer held the note too long

definitions.text: a tone of voice that shows what the speaker is feeling
examples: there was a note of uncertainty in his voice
it ended on a sour note
there was a note of gaiety in her manner
he detected a note of sarcasm

definitions.text: a piece of paper money (especially one issued by a central bank)
examples: he peeled off five one-thousand-zloty notes
his notes were appended at the end of the article
he added a short notation to the address on the envelope

definitions.text: high status importance owing to marked superiority
a promise to pay a specified amount on demand or at a certain time
examples: I had to co-sign his note at the bank
She observed that his presentation took up too much time
They noted that it was a fine day to go sailing
She noted that someone was following her

definitions.text: observe with care or pay close attention to
examples: Take note of this chemical reaction
she noted everything the teacher said that morning
